conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

Source A is located at the top left, source B is in the middle, and source C is at the top right. There are colored baffles (red, green, etc.) angled in various directions, and containers D and E are at the bottom.
The red baffle is angled to direct liquid towards the left.
Liquid from A flows directly downward and hits the red baffle.
The red baffle directs the liquid from A towards the left.
The liquid from A continues downward and is directed into container E.
The green baffle is angled to direct liquid towards the right.
Liquid from B flows downward and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from B towards the right.
The liquid from B continues downward and is directed into container D.
Liquid from C flows downward and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle directs the liquid from C towards the right.
The liquid from C continues downward and is directed into container D.
Final Answer: Liquid from A flows into container E, liquid from B flows into container D, and liquid from C flows into container D.
